intro: Neomolina ulicina, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in a variety of colors, including green, silver, and purple. Neomolina ulicina is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
